page.title: 16Tourism - Mattingley Area.
page.content: Anyone stopping for a picnic or a walk across{Hazeley Heath}with its fine views may get a glimpse of the magnificent Bramshill Police College (just outside the block). The main tourist attraction is the C.18th{West {Green House, a National Trust property but only a few ground floor rooms can be viewed & it has restricted opening hours. The gardens are interesting with numerous 'nooks & crannies', some formal areas, a display of Bonsai Trees & topiary & a few waterfowl. The {C.15th Mattingley Church}with its unique structure of a timber frame with herringbone brickwork also attracts many visitors. The lucky 'tourist' might stumble upon the scenic setting of{Dipley Mill}on the {River Whitewater}or the attractive groups of{timber-framed cottages.
